title: Polarization - 2 spring wave pulses and polarizer

content.description: Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows a long spring that is stretched between two fixed vertical posts. The center of the spring lies between two horizontal rectangular plates that are fixed in place, with only a narrow space between the spring and each plate. Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows a side view of a transverse pulse of amplitude <math alttext="A sub T comma i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext>T,i</mtext></msub></math>, which is initially near the left end of the coil and traveling to the right. A short time later, the pulse has passed between the plates and has amplitude <math alttext="A sub T comma f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext> T,f</mtext></msub></math>. In Figure <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, a longitudinal pulse of amplitude <math alttext="A sub L comma i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext> L,i</mtext></msub></math> is near the left end of the coil and traveling to the right. This pulse also passes between the plates, after which it has amplitude <math alttext="A sub L comma f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mtext> L,f</mtext></msub></math>.
